instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b that wont boot all the way i try to boot thru USB same thing i try loading OS thru USB same thing wouldn't boot normal also with known good HDD. Any Ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: Boot in safe mode, hold left shift. If that does not work boot in verbose mode and see where it hangs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: In Verbose mode it's stuck on   BTCoex: <SIGNAL>ENABLE_2G</SIGNAL>:1, <SIGNAL>PROFILE_2G</SIGNAL>:0, <SIGNAL>ENABLE_5G</SIGNAL>:1, <SIGNAL>PROFILE_5G</SIGNAL>:0   is that something for the Bluetooth?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: on the mother board im missing <SIGNAL>USB_BT_CONN_P</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>USB_BT_CONN_P</SIGNAL> they are coming from <CHIP>U3510</CHIP> i have 3.3V on pin 10 of <CHIP>U3510</CHIP> and that's <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> i have VCC on pin 9

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: Another save mode boot plus Verbose mode the last message i see is hfs: unmount initiated on Recovery HD on device disk0s3 and it stops there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: No idea.....Did you try known good RAM?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: Okay after long visual inspection I've burn my finger on <TRANSISTOR>Q8360</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q8361</TRANSISTOR> and on the other side is <CHIP>U8350</CHIP> i measured around on L8360 i have 1.3 volts but im not sure why those two mosfets are so hot they work properly i think. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: <SIGNAL>GPU_FBVDDQ_SENSE_N</SIGNAL> is missing that's signal that should go in <CHIP>U8350</CHIP> and that signal comes from <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> pin 532 so called KEPLER FRAME BUFFER I/F  I believe that's the GPU????  :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: What is resistance to GND on L8360?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message:
it is 180 ohm.  

I've noticed that i can install windows but not OSX im assuming is the GPU because when i try to install the driver for the nvidia computer got black screen also i was thinking that when osx is loading from bootable USB or OSX HDD is loading the drivers also thats why it can't load the osx on the other hand windows i loading with no drivers or just the minimal required drivers to install windows. That's my opinion. Can you tell me what the measurement for resistance to GND on L8360 tell you???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b won't boot all the way
threads.message: Did you have any luck with this? I have the same problem
